normalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Waste Management in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26 – India faces a pressing waste management challenge. Experts at IIT-Bombay emphasize the urgent need for improved segregation and recycling practices to reduce landfill burden. Currently, a significant portion of waste ends up in overflowing landfills like the Ghazipur landfill, posing serious environmental and health risks.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty six – India faces a pressing waste management challenge. Experts at I I T-Bombay emphasize the urgent need for improved segregation and recycling practices to reduce landfill burden. Currently, a significant portion of waste ends up in overflowing landfills like the Ghazipur landfill, posing serious environmental and health risks.

unnormalised: The Swachh Bharat Mission, launched on 02/10/2014, has made strides in sanitation but efficient waste processing remains a hurdle. A recent study reveals that approximately 62 million tonnes of waste are generated annually, with projections estimating a rise to 165 million tonnes by 2030 if current trends persist.
normalised: The Swachh Bharat Mission, launched on second October two thousand and fourteen, has made strides in sanitation but efficient waste processing remains a hurdle. A recent study reveals that approximately sixty two million tonnes of waste are generated annually, with projections estimating a rise to one hundred and sixty five million tonnes by two thousand and thirty if current trends persist.

unnormalised: Proper composting and biogas generation from organic waste are crucial. At 09:00 hrs today, a webinar hosted by the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) highlighted innovative technologies for waste-to-energy conversion. These initiatives are essential to move towards a "circular economy" and uphold the spirit of environmental responsibility ingrained since 15/08/1947. Local communities, like those in Chennai managing plastic waste through self-help groups, demonstrate the power of grassroots initiatives in creating a cleaner, healthier India. The implementation of effective waste management policies is vital for a sustainable future.
